work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

education.institution: Weill Cornell Medicine and Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center

awards.title: PhD Fellowship
awards.awarder: Followship for the whole duration of the PhD
awards.summary: The PhD Fellowship is a prestigious award that aims to support the most talented students in the field of computational biology.

publications.name: DriveWays
publications.summary: DriveWays is a project that aims to predict the impact of mutations on RNA splicing. The project is based on the analysis of RNA-seq data and the development of machine learning models.

skills.name: Computational Biology
keywords: Perform various differential analyses, Analyze CLIP and RNA-editing based assays, Apply machine learning techniques to functional genomic data
